intro: Elaeocarpus gammillii, commonly known as the New Guinea elaeocarpus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Elaeocarpaceae. It is native to the island of New Guinea and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, white to pink flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically borne in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
